question: A p-n junction diode is connected to a battery of emf 5.7 V in series with a resistance 5 <katex>$\Omega$</katex> (or k<katex>$\Omega$</katex>) such that it is forward biased. If the barrier potential of the diode is 0.7 V, neglecting the diode resistance, the current in the circuit is
explanation: Given the answer choices, the resistance is likely 5 k<katex>$\Omega$</katex>.
